alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 23 at 12:54PM PST until February 24 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches, with up to 4 inches above 1500 feet. * WHERE...Highway 101, especially from Port Orford south and portions of highway 42 near the Coos/Douglas county line. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 7 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Most of the snow is expected to accumulate between 7 pm and 1 am pst. Most parts of highway 101 are expected to get an inch or less, except up to 2 inches over the higher parts of 101. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
